title: Much for little

title: My experience with Toogoodtogo so far
text:
On a paltry teacher salary, I don‚Äôt have the time or money to waste on a poor experience in a restaurant or cafe, and certainly not on sub par food.  This app gives me the opportunity to try new places at a minimal cost.  
Just stopping to pick up a to go order gives me as much info as I need by glimpsing first hand the location and staff.   If the food turns out to be good, the atmosphere and staff friendly, I‚Äôll be back. 
 I‚Äôve discovered a few places through this app that I now visit regularly or will be returning to at the first opportunity.  
Sometimes I use this app just to break up the monotony of my workweek meals by trying new places and new-to-me foods affordably.
Kudos to whomever came up with this idea!

title: Dufner‚Äôs Donuts and Deli
text: My first time here and pleasantly surprised. They had a multitude of different kinds of raised donuts. Various glazed, frosted, Bavarian cream filled and specialty ones. They were so light and not greasy and ample glaze or frosting. Very tasty. Nice to know there is another good bakery in town. I didn‚Äôt try any of the sandwiches from the deli, but it seemed like they had a large varied menu. Next time!!

title: Great idea, execution is based on the retailer
text:
The idea is simple: restaurants & other retailers have food that is perishable - if it doesn‚Äôt sell, toss it! Usually not because it‚Äôll spoil, but because quality standards demand it.
The retailers who get it set aside the ‚Äúspoils‚Äù at the end of the day & make them available here at a big discount (think ‚Äúday old bread store‚Äù but for a lot more than bread).
But there are some who just use this app as a gimmick to get customers to come in & try them out. You‚Äôre not saving anything - they just give you things off the shelf like any other customer, and without much in the way of savings. Once I get those, I just avoid them going forward.
Still, for the ones who get it, this is an awesome app! I‚Äôve had meals I‚Äôd never have ordered on my own, & my kids have tried pastries & bread products they‚Äôd have never eaten otherwise!

title: So far not impressed
text:
I‚Äôve tried 5 different stores and only one actually gave me decent food.
Morton Williams gave me two disgusting sandwiches with stale bread. Cobert & Conely gave me rice with mushy pasta smashed on top and a piece of rubbery chicken that was the size of a post it. Fresh &co was the worst, not only did they give me inedible food they were incredibly rude as well. The only place I‚Äôve lucked out at is Harry‚Äôs Table. The food was fresh and there was a variety of it and the staff was incredibly friendly.
Too many of these places behave as if they are doing you a favor, which is missing the point entirely.
I don‚Äôt think this is really worth it.

title: Needs update

title: ONE OF THE BEST APPS

title: Great app; need to see the reviews
text: I‚Äôve used this app 5 out 6 times now.  It‚Äôs a great idea and I love getting my surprise bags.  There are several places that I would love to try but I won‚Äôt because I can‚Äôt read the reviews.  There is no reason to have a review rating if there is no transparency to read the reviews.

title: Keep This Going!!!
text: I appreciate the creators and developers of their it really does help help when your in a pinch. I so grateful and happy that this app exists.

title: Mid
text:
I‚Äôve used this app for about a week now and have done 5 different pickups. I will say that the concept behind the app is awesome; we waste so much food in this country, and I live in LA, so the issue is amplified. That being said, the execution of this app has room for major improvements.

1. Variety - I guess it depends on where you live, but about 80% of the restaurant options available to me are donuts. And I live in the heart of LA. I don‚Äôt understand the limited options? 

2. Transparency - It would be awesome if we could see WHY a restaurant has a particular rating. I want to see how other‚Äôs experiences went.  

3. Alignment - I‚Äôm finding that some vendors don‚Äôt necessarily align with the whole fighting food waste movement. For 3 of my 5 pickups, the employees just ran around the shop finding random things to throw in the bag, that weren‚Äôt even expired or bad. I think some vendors take advantage of users and are just on the app to make a quick buck. It‚Äôs really unfortunate and TGTG should screen users for this when we rate the pickup experience. 

Overall, a wonderful concept. I just really wish it was deployed better because it seriously has amazing potential.

title: Win win
text: I recently tried out this food rescue app for the first time, and I must say, it was a delightful experience! I ordered two bags, each brimming with about seven delicious bagels and a delightful treat‚Äîa choice between a flaky croissant or two scrumptious scones. To top it off, I received a complimentary coffee with cream and sugar. The staff were exceptionally friendly and expressed genuine gratitude for my effort in rescuing food. Overall, it was a wonderful first encounter with the app, and I felt it offered great value for the price. Highly recommended for anyone looking to prevent food waste while enjoying tasty treats!

title: Try something new

title: A bit too hit-and-miss
text: This (‚ÄúTGTG‚Äù) is a great app. It serves a great purpose: salvaging good food from waste. Some of the surprise bags are brilliant. But there are stores putting low value items in the bag, sometimes several of the same kind, that devalue the bag and the experience. Unfortunately, a downside of the app is that it hides the reviews made through the app so that individuals cannot critique the stores directly, for others to saee. Instead, one must rely on the TGTG editors, who collate responses and characterize them. It reminds me of the old Zagat for restaurants model.

title: Great to save money and expand your palate
text:
This app has gotten so much better since it first started.
The variety and ease of searching makes it really easy to explore all the great restaurants available on it and the money saved can be be a bit addictive, i sometimes buy 2-3 different ones a day just because of the great deal you can sometimes get
